Title: GD: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis: The GD library is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability.

Background.Text: GD is a graphic library for fast image creation.

Description.Text: Tomas Hoger reported that the _gdGetColors() function in gd_gd.c does not properly verify the colorsTotal struct member, possibly leading to a buffer overflow.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image file with a program using the GD library, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All GD users should upgrade to the latest version:

NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are
    available since November 21, 2009. It is likely that your system is
    already no longer affected by this issue.
